question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute $\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ.$
inference:
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 4 \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
Using the double angle formula $\sin(2\theta) = 2\sin\theta\cos\theta$, we have
$\sin(2\cdot 20^\circ) = 2\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ$, so $2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ = \sin 40^\circ$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 4 \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 2 \cdot 2 \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 2 \sin 40^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
Using the identity $\sin 3\theta = 3 \sin \theta - 4 \sin^3\theta$.
$\sin 60^\circ = 3\sin 20^\circ - 4 \sin^3 20^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$.
Using the identity $1 + 2 \cos 20^\circ = 1 + \cos 40^\circ = 2 \cos^2 20^\circ$.
Recall the identity $4\sin x \cos x = 2\sin(2x)$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2\sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2\cdot2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2\sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 60^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin (2\cdot 30^\circ - 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \sqrt{3}$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{\sqrt{3}}$
ground_truth:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + 4 \sin 20^\circ \\
&= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.
\end{align*}By double angle formula,
\[\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.\]Then by sum-to-product,
\begin{align*}
\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.
\end{align*}Again by sum-to-product,
\[\frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = 2 \cos 30^\circ = \boxed{\sqrt{3}}.\]

question:
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 4 \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
Using the double angle formula $\sin(2\theta) = 2\sin\theta\cos\theta$, we have
$\sin(2\cdot 20^\circ) = 2\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ$, so $2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ = \sin 40^\circ$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 4 \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 2 \cdot 2 \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ (1 + 2 \sin 40^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
Using the identity $\sin 3\theta = 3 \sin \theta - 4 \sin^3\theta$.
$\sin 60^\circ = 3\sin 20^\circ - 4 \sin^3 20^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$.
Using the identity $1 + 2 \cos 20^\circ = 1 + \cos 40^\circ = 2 \cos^2 20^\circ$.
Recall the identity $4\sin x \cos x = 2\sin(2x)$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2\sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2\cdot2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2\sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 60^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin (2\cdot 30^\circ - 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \sqrt{3}$.

inference:
$\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + 4 \sin 20^\circ = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2(2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
Using the sum-to-product formula $\sin A + \sin B = 2 \sin\left(\frac{A+B}{2}\right)\cos\left(\frac{A-B}{2}\right)$,
$\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ = \sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin (2 \cdot 20^\circ) = \sin 20^\circ + 2(2 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ) = \sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ$.
$\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ = \sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ = \sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ$.
Using the formula $\sin A + \sin 2A = 2 \sin \left(\frac{A+2A}{2}\right) \cos \left(\frac{A-2A}{2}\right) = 2 \sin \frac{3A}{2} \cos \frac{-A}{2}$,
$\sin 20^\circ + \sin 60^\circ = \sin 20^\circ + \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} = \sin 20^\circ + \sin (90^\circ - 30^\circ) = \sin 20^\circ + \cos 30^\circ$.
This doesn't seem to work.

$\sin 20^\circ + 2\sin 40^\circ = \sin 20^\circ + 2(2\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ) = \sin 20^\circ + 4\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ$.
$\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2\sin(2(20^\circ))}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2(2\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}$.
$\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2(2\sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ(1 + 4\cos 20^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ} = \tan 20^\circ + 4\sin 20^\circ$.


$\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2\sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2(\frac{1}{2}) \cos 10^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\cos 10^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \sqrt{3}$.

$\boxed{\sqrt{3}}$
ground_truth:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\tan 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + 4 \sin 20^\circ \\
&= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.
\end{align*}By double angle formula,
\[\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 4 \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.\]Then by sum-to-product,
\begin{align*}
\frac{\sin 20^\circ + 2 \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + \sin 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}.
\end{align*}Again by sum-to-product,
\[\frac{\cos 10^\circ + \cos 50^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = \frac{2 \cos 30^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} = 2 \cos 30^\circ = \boxed{\sqrt{3}}.\]
